00065     // lex and peak uses the template parameter to branch on the action, which
00066     // triggers clangs tautological comparison on the single-comparison
00067     // branches. This is not a bug, just a merging of behaviour into
00068     // one function
00069 
00070 #pragma clang diagnostic push
00071 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wtautological-compare"
00072 
00073 #endif

00077 
00078     // skip over spaces, tabs and line comments
00079     template <prelexer mx>
00080     const char* sneak(const char* start = 0)
00081     {
00082 
00083       // maybe use optional start position from arguments?
00084       const char* it_position = start ? start : position;
00085 
00086       // skip white-space?
00087       if (mx == spaces ||
00088           mx == no_spaces ||
00089           mx == css_comments ||
00090           mx == css_whitespace ||
00091           mx == optional_spaces ||
00092           mx == optional_css_comments ||
00093           mx == optional_css_whitespace
00094       ) {
00095         return it_position;
00096       }
00097 
00098       // skip over spaces, tabs and sass line comments
00099       const char* pos = optional_css_whitespace(it_position);
00100       // always return a valid position
00101       return pos ? pos : it_position;
00102 
00103     }
00104 
00105     // peek will only skip over space, tabs and line comment
00106     // return the position where the lexer match will occur
00107     template <prelexer mx>
00108     const char* peek(const char* start = 0)
00109     {
00110 
00111       // sneak up to the actual token we want to lex
00112       // this should skip over white-space if desired
00113       const char* it_before_token = sneak < mx >(start);
00114 
00115       // match the given prelexer
00116       return mx(it_before_token);
00117 
00118     }
00119 
00120     // white-space handling is built into the lexer
00121     // this way you do not need to parse it yourself
00122     // some matchers don't accept certain white-space
00123     // we do not support start arg, since we manipulate
00124     // sourcemap offset and we modify the position pointer!
00125     // lex will only skip over space, tabs and line comment
00126     template <prelexer mx>
00127     const char* lex(bool lazy = true)
00128     {
00129 
00130       // position considered before lexed token
00131       // we can skip whitespace or comments for
00132       // lazy developers (but we need control)
00133       const char* it_before_token = position;
00134 
00135       // sneak up to the actual token we want to lex
00136       // this should skip over white-space if desired
00137       if (lazy) it_before_token = sneak < mx >(position);
00138 
00139       // now call matcher to get position after token
00140       const char* it_after_token = mx(it_before_token);
00141 
00142       // assertion that we got a valid match
00143       if (it_after_token == 0) return 0;
00144       // assertion that we actually lexed something
00145       if (it_after_token == it_before_token) return 0;
00146 
00147       // create new lexed token object (holds all parse result information)
00148       lexed = Token(position, it_before_token, it_after_token);
00149 
00150       // advance position (add whitespace before current token)
00151       before_token = after_token.add(position, it_before_token);
00152 
00153       // update after_token position for current token
00154       after_token.add(it_before_token, it_after_token);
00155 
00156       // ToDo: could probably do this incremetal on original object (API wants offset?)
00157       pstate = ParserState(path, source, lexed, before_token, after_token - before_token);
00158 
00159       // advance internal char iterator
00160       return position = it_after_token;
00161 
00162     }
00163 
00164     // lex_css skips over space, tabs, line and block comment
00165     // all block comments will be consumed and thrown away
00166     // source-map position will point to token after the comment
00167     template <prelexer mx>
00168     const char* lex_css()
00169     {
00170       // copy old token
00171       Token prev = lexed;
00172       // throw away comments
00173       // update srcmap position
00174       lex < css_comments >();
00175       // now lex a new token
00176       const char* pos = lex< mx >();
00177       // maybe restore prev token
00178       if (pos == 0) lexed = prev;
00179       // return match
00180       return pos;
00181     }
00182 
00183     // all block comments will be skipped and thrown away
00184     template <prelexer mx>
00185     const char* peek_css(const char* start = 0)
00186     {
00187       // now peek a token (skip comments first)
00188       return peek< mx >(peek < css_comments >(start));
00189     }
